授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to learn about ageing societies and how they affect the economy, health care, social services, women and families, paid workers, communities, and future opportunities for young people in Canada and Japan.
到達目標:
Students will:
• Understand why Canada and Japan are ageing so quickly and how this affects all parts of society including young people
• Discuss current issues in ageing societies including rising health and social care costs; the changing role of women and family caregivers; foreign workers; the use of robots and technology; age-friendly and dementia-friendly communities; doctor-assisted death; and future opportunities for young people in Canada and Japan
• Learn how to write and present short “briefing notes” on current issues.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Learning activities include lectures by the professor, student discussions and short student presentations.

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
Students will write two short (1000–1200 words) “briefing notes” on course topics. A briefing note gives the reader a basic understanding of a topic (e.g., family caregivers) and what governments are doing about it (e.g., giving family caregivers paid time off work). Sources can include short media reports and other credible on-line sources (e.g., the World Health Organization). Each student will also give a short (5-10 minute) in-class presentation on a course topic; an in-class presentation can be on the same topic covered in a student's written briefing note. Students will receive marks for attendance and participation.

Briefing Note 1 20%
